channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Most Inc. 5000 Companies Don’t Train Their Salespeople. Here’s Why
item.description: Exclusive data from our CEO Survey shows that just over 50 percent of the country’s fastest-growing small businesses don’t offer their sales team form...

item.title: Trump’s New H1-B Visa Fee Is Great News for European Startups
item.description: The president’s decision to massively raise the H-1B visa fee has U.S. founders worried…while European entrepreneurs are popping champagne.

item.title: How Gen-Z Is ‘AI-proofing’ Their Careers
item.description: ‘This isn’t an isolated trend—it’s becoming a generational pattern.’

item.title: Jerome Powell Sees Froth in the Stock Market and Limited Tariff Inflation
item.description: The Fed Chairman says the biggest risk lies in the labor market.

item.title: The hottest workplace policy at startups right now: No shoes
item.description: Silicon Valley startups are embracing one of their favorite work-from-home perks: attending meetings in just socks.

item.title: Norma Kamali wants AI to keep hallucinating

item.title: Markets are selling off after the Fed’s Powell said six words investors don’t want to hear: ‘Equity prices are fairly highly valued’
item.description: Investors are wary of any sign that the Fed thinks “irrational exuberance”—as former Fed chair Alan Greenspan once called it—has kicked in.

item.title: LexisNexis exec says it’s ‘a matter of time’ before attorneys lose their licenses over using open-source AI pilots in court
item.description: AI is rapidly being adopted into law firms across the country, and it’s raising stakes for attorneys and their clients alike.

item.title: Robot Umpires? How the New Technology Is Expected to Change Major League Baseball
item.description: The Automated Ball/Strike System is stepping up to the plate in the major leagues in 2026.

item.description: Powell is nearing the end of a tumultuous second term.
